name: imageDrawOval
syntax: imageDrawOval(name, x, y, width, height [, filled])

params.name: name
params.description: The image on which this operation is performed.

params.name: x
params.description: The x coordinate of the upper left corner of the oval to draw.

params.name: y
params.description: The y coordinate of the upper left corner of the oval to draw.

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the oval to draw.

params.name: height
params.description: The height of the oval to draw.

params.name: filled
params.description: Specify whether the oval is filled

examples.title: Tag Syntax
examples.description: This example shows how to draw a green filled oval.
examples.code:
<!--- Use the imageNew function to create a 200x110-pixel image. ---> 
 <cfset myImage=imageNew("",200,110)> 
 <!--- Set the drawing color to green. ---> 
 <cfset imageSetDrawingColor(myImage,"green")> 
 <!--- Turn on antialiasing to improve image quality. ---> 
 <cfset imageSetAntialiasing(myImage,"on")> 
 <!--- Draw a filled green oval on the image. ---> 
 <cfset imageDrawOval(myImage,5,5,190,100,"yes")> 
 <!--- Display the image in a browser. ---> 
 <cfimage source="#myImage#" action="writeToBrowser">

examples.title: Using drawOval member function
examples.description: CF11+ Lucee4.5+ Create a new image and with this image draw a white oval (width=50, height=70) start from (50,40)
